t; any-
body would grant that it is. But no one may choose between you and Jones
who is to have it.”



451
Weighing Factors
We should really ask what it is that says “no one may choose” in the face
of the fact that the body that houses the child is the mother’s body. It may be
simply a failure to appreciate this fact. But it may be something more inter-
esting, namely the sense that one has a right to refuse to lay hands on peo-
ple, even where it would be just and fair to do so, even where jus
